title: Before & after: Satellite pics show Op Sindoor’s impact on Pak air bases, terror camps
content: Following ceasefire talks, Jammu and Kashmir remained peaceful. India released satellite images showcasing the damage inflicted on Pakistani bases during 'Operation Sindoor,' where precision strikes targeted terrorist facilities linked to JeM and LeT, responsible for past attacks. In response to Pakistani aggression, India launched kamikaze drones, damaging 11 bases and significantly impacting Pakistan's air force infrastructure.

title: Rohit hits back at criticism: 'Defending myself is waste of time'
content: Rohit Sharma recently spoke about handling criticism. He acknowledged its impact but emphasised learning to manage it. He addressed concerns about his vulnerability to left-arm seamers. He highlighted his successful ODI career, including a record score. He also reflected on his Test journey, noting his role in the World Test Championship. He recently retired from Test cricket.

title: 'Will hit terrorists in Pak': Jaishankar told US a week after Pahalgam attack
content: Following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam that killed 26 tourists, India vowed to strike terrorists in Pakistan. Tensions escalated as India retaliated with strikes on terrorist locations, leading to Pakistan's aggressive response targeting Indian military installations. Despite a ceasefire agreement, violations were reported.

title: Carney in trouble: Nearly 1.6 mn out of job in Canada, 30,000+ cuts in April
content: Canada's economy faces headwinds as April 2025 saw a meager 7,400 jobs added, pushing unemployment to 6.9%. U.S. tariffs on key exports like steel and automobiles are significantly impacting the manufacturing sector, leading to job losses. While the public sector offered slight relief, broader economic concerns persist, pressuring the Bank of Canada to consider interest rate cuts.

title: Virender Sehwag lambasts Pakistan in social media post
content: Virender Sehwag's recent social media activity has ignited patriotic fervour, following his critical remarks aimed at Pakistan. He shared a powerful image contrasting the Indian and Pakistani armed forces, reinforcing his stance after condemning ceasefire violations. This came after India's Operation Sindoor, a retaliatory strike against terror camps, further escalating tensions and reflecting a strong national sentiment against cross-border terrorism.

title: No heavy blasts in Udhampur, govt says rumours aimed at creating panic
content: The government has dismissed as false social media claims of explosions in Udhampur and drone sightings in Jammu and Kashmir, urging the public to trust only official sources. The rumours surfaced amid India-Pakistan tensions following the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 people. India retaliated with strikes on terror camps; both nations have now agreed to a ceasefire.

title: 'Bekaar': Rohit makes shocking statement about naturally-gifted player
content: Rohit Sharma, dismissing the notion of natural talent in cricket, asserted that success stems from relentless hard work, not innate ability. He emphasised that appearing effortless requires immense dedication, highlighting his own journey from a bowler to a celebrated batsman. Sharma's leadership, marked by India's 2025 Champions Trophy win, further exemplifies his earned greatness.

title: Bill Gates' ex-wife opens up on his plan to give away wealth: 'Think it's...'
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: Rohit Sharma breaks silence on ODI retirement: 'I will stop when...'
content: Rohit Sharma clarifies his ODI plans. He acknowledges his past achievements but focuses on evolving his batting style. Sharma aims for a more aggressive approach. He promises to retire when he feels he can no longer contribute effectively. He recently retired from Test cricket. Sharma led India to victory in the 2025 Champions Trophy.

title: ‘Gift, free of charge’: Trump breaks silence on reported Qatari jet deal
content: Donald Trump defended accepting a luxury jet from Qatar for Air Force One, calling it a free gift and accusing Democrats of outrage over a cost-saving deal. Critics argue it violates the Emoluments Clause, citing ethical concerns and potential corruption. The White House defends the arrangement, stating the Pentagon would accept the jet, not Trump personally, negating bribery accusations.

title: Mark Zuckerberg manages Meta through a 'core team' of 30: 'When I say I don’t...'
content: Mark Zuckerberg employs an unconventional leadership style at Meta, directly managing a core team of 25-30 executives without regular one-on-one meetings. This approach promotes self-management and autonomy among his key leaders. Zuckerberg emphasizes open communication and strategic alignment through weekly discussions, fostering a flat corporate structure aimed at efficiency and agility within Meta's diverse divisions.

title: JEE Advanced admit card 2025 to release today: Check details here
content: The Indian Institute of Technology will release the JEE Advanced 2025 admit cards on May 12 at 10:00 AM on jeeadv.ac.in. Only registered candidates who qualified JEE Main 2025 can download the hall ticket. With the exam scheduled for May 18, candidates must carry the admit card and a valid ID to avoid disqualification or denied entry.

title: 13 dead including women & children, several injured in Chhattisgarh road crash
content: A devastating road accident on the Raipur-Baloda Bazar highway claimed the lives of at least 13 people, including women and children, as a goods vehicle carrying passengers collided head-on with a speeding trailer truck. The victims were returning from a postnatal ceremony when the tragic incident occurred near Saragaon.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for the week starting May 12
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends Indian Oil Corporation Ltd and M&M as top stock picks for the week starting May 12, 2025. IOCL's Q4FY25 EBITDA significantly exceeded estimates due to higher GRM and marketing margins, with near-term catalysts expected to boost Q1 earnings.

title: Uber CEO to employees working from home: You have “to make a choice”
content: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi is enforcing a stricter return-to-office policy, requiring employees to work in the office three days a week. This decision has sparked internal tension, with some employees expressing concerns about burnout and logistical challenges. Khosrowshahi has warned that those unwilling to comply may need to seek employment elsewhere, citing a strong job market.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner, then open laptops to…
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: Buddha Purnima 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: Buddha Purnima, observed on May 12, 2025, commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Gautama Buddha. This auspicious day encourages reflection on Buddha's teachings of peace, compassion, and mindfulness. Celebrations include prayers, offerings, and acts of charity, inspiring individuals to embrace kindness and inner peace, sharing messages and quotes to promote universal well-being.

title: “I’ll be back soon”: Kayleigh McEnany speaks out after on-air health scare
content: Kayleigh McEnany, a Fox News personality, had a health scare during a live broadcast. The incident prompted concern among viewers. McEnany has since confirmed she is doing well. She thanked the Fox News team and EMTs for their quick response. She also expressed gratitude for the support she received. McEnany is resting and plans to return to television soon.

title: Harshvardhan Rane slams Mawra Hocane’s remark after quitting Sanam Teri Kasam 2
content: Harshvardhan Rane recently announced his decision to opt out of Sanam Teri Kasam 2 amid growing tensions between India and Pakistan. In response, Mawra issued a lengthy statement, calling Harshvardhan’s exit a “PR strategy” and accused him of being “desperate and hungry” for headlines. Harshvardhan didn’t take the comments lightly.

title: Just 5 minutes of junk food ads can drive kids to eat more: Study
content: A recent study reveals that even brief exposure to junk food advertising significantly increases children's calorie consumption, regardless of whether the ads feature actual food. This constant bombardment of marketing, prevalent across various platforms, contributes to childhood obesity and related health issues. Addressing this requires a multi-faceted approach involving parents, schools, and policymakers to promote healthier lifestyles.

title: Amber Heard announces birth of twins on Mother's Day amid fertility challenges
content: Amber Heard joyfully announced the arrival of her twins, Agnes and Ocean, on Mother's Day 2025. Sharing the news on Instagram, she expressed her elation in completing her family, expanding it from one to three children. Heard also opened up about her past fertility challenges, emphasizing her gratitude for achieving motherhood on her own terms.

title: ‘Kesari Chapter 2’ nears Rs90 cr at box office by day 24, wraps fourth sunday
content: Akshay Kumar's courtroom drama, 'Kesari Chapter 2', is nearing the end of its successful theatrical run, earning Rs 86.80 crore in India after 24 days. Despite facing competition from 'Raid 2', the film held its ground, driven by strong performances and an emotional storyline based on the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

title: Air Marshal on Op Sindoor: 'Terror camps decimated, casualties for Pak to count'
content: Amidst escalating cross-border tensions, India executed Operation Sindoor, successfully destroying terror camps across the border, as confirmed by Air Marshal AK Bharti. The operation, a response to the Pahalgam terror attack, achieved its objectives with precision, leading to the downing of several Pakistani planes. Despite a ceasefire agreement, violations occurred, prompting India to urge responsible action from Pakistan.

title: 'Indian Navy was in position to strike Karachi': Vice Admiral on Operation Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the Indian Navy swiftly deployed its carrier battle group to the Arabian Sea, adopting a combat-ready posture under Operation Sindoor. This deployment aimed to deter further aggression, with the capability to strike key targets, including Karachi. Despite Pakistan's subsequent ceasefire proposal, a breach occurred shortly after, highlighting the volatile situation.

title: MS Dhoni's silent tribute? His t-shirt sends a loud message - WATCH
content: MS Dhoni was seen on a flight sporting a "Duty, Honour, Country" t-shirt, as IPL 2025 remains suspended. The BCCI is working to resume the tournament, likely by Thursday or Friday, excluding Dharamsala as a venue due to security concerns following drone strikes. Chennai Super Kings have been eliminated from playoff contention.

title: Spoiler alert: New political parties spring up in poll-bound Bihar
content: Aap Sabki Awaz (Rashtriya) by former IAS officer R.C.P. Singh, Inquilab Party (IIP) by former Congress leader I.P. Gupta and Hind Sena Party by former IPS officer Shivdeep Wamanrao Lande may queer the pitch for the big players

title: Vikram Misri online trolling row: Former diplomat, politicians come out in support
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi and former Foreign Secretary Nirupama Menon expressed their support for Mr. Misri

title: How is Kerala handling its waste problem? | Explained
content: What is the ‘Vruthi’ campaign? How has waste increased in Kerala society? Is this campaign different from the Swachh Bharat Mission? Are decentralised waste management systems better than centralised ones?

title: 13 dead, 11 injured in trailer-truck collision in Raipur
content: Four children and nine women died in the road accident that happened late Sunday (May 11, 2025) night near Saragaon on Raipur-Balodabazar road in Raipur district

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire LIVE: Night remained largely peaceful, no incidents reported, says Indian Army
content: The nights of May 7, 8, and 9, besides the morning of May 10, saw massive strikes by Pakistan using drones, missiles and Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicles (UCAVs) targeting civilian and military locations across the western border

title: CPI accuses BJP of using religion as political weapon to gain power
content: Mr. Nageswara Rao was in the city to participate as chief guest in the Visakhapatnam district’s 25th ‘Maha Sabhalu’ on Sunday

title: Special officers appointed for Saraswati Pushkaralu; Minister Sridhar Babu inspects preparations
content: The 12-day Saraswati Pushkaralu will begin on May 15 at Triveni Sangamam near Kaleshwaram, where the Godavari, Pranahita, and the invisible Saraswati rivers converge

title: No compromise if somebody hurts dignity of court, says Justice Gavai
content: The Chief Justice of India-designate says “some other judges would have taken a different view” of BJP MP Nishikant Dubey’s comments against the Supreme Court and Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna

title: The women who remain largely invisible
content: Too often, women do the groundwork — organising, protesting, feeding, and sustaining movements — without having a seat at the table

title: The curious case of Kejriwal’s ‘shift’ from Delhi to Punjab
content: While Mr. Kejriwal has gone quiet in Delhi, he has been making frequent and visible appearances in Punjab

title: Gandhi Hill all set to receive a major facelift
content: With the government clearing the decks for its renovation, good days are ahead for the historic site, where a memorial for Mahatma Gandhi stands and which has fallen into disrepair in the recent years

title: Wife of BSF constable detained by Pakistan seeks meeting with Bengal CM Mamata
content: The BSF jawan inadvertently crossed the international border on April 23 and was taken into custody by Pakistan Rangers. Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee has also taken up the issue and spoken to the Director General of the BSF

title: Experts shed light on rising importance of data during The Hindu Education Plus Career Counselling Series webinar
content: Experts emphasize the value of integrating economics with data science in academic programmes and that working with data is no longer optional but an essential skill

title: Prison inmates’ spirit shines at Cherlapally as annual sports and cultural meet ends on a high note
content: The meet, running from May 9 to 11, blended athleticism with artistry and aimed to provide inmates with a structured platform for reinvention and reintegration

title: Telangana finds its chill; beer sales jump by 65% amid heatwave
content: Daily sales began climbing in early May, peaking at 2.9 lakh cases on May 4, as per data from Telangana Excise and Prohibition Department

title: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri abused on social media; IAS, IPS associations come out in support
content: Vikram Misri had to lock his X account following abusive comments on his daughter by users who blamed him for the cessation of military operations agreed with Pakistan. The IAS Association condemns the “unwarranted personal attacks on civil servants performing their duties with integrity”

title: World’s longest banana infructescence found in the forests of Andamans
content: An infructescence of about 4.2 metres long has been recorded in an endemic species of wild banana, the Musa indandamanensis. Specimens of  the infructescence are on display at the Indian Museum in Kolkata

title: Pakistan will have to pay a very heavy price if it resorts to any misadventure, says DGMO
content: 35-40 Pakistani military personnel killed in combat, key installations damaged during Operation Sindoor; the officer warns Pak. against ‘misadventure’, pays tribute to 5 Indian military casualties

title: UGC tells institutions to increase number of seats, admit more foreign students
content: Stressing need for internationalisation of higher education, UGC Secretary Manish R. Joshi urges institutions to implement the Commission’s 2022 guidelines to create up to 25% ‘supernumerary seats’, over and above the sanctioned enrolment, for international students in UG and PG courses

title: Indus Waters Treaty to be kept in abeyance as Pakistan resorted to cross-border terror: source
content: The Indus Waters Treaty has to be modified to ‘make it suitable for the 21st century requirements of the Indian state’, the senior official said, adding there would be rapid infrastructure development works in the rivers that were a part of the treaty

title: Demand to strengthen govt. hospitals in Kozhikode
content: On the night of May 2, a temporary facility was set up at the general hospital to shift patients from the casualty ward of the Government MCH after a minor explosion in the UPS room

title: Foreign investors inject ₹14,167 crore in equities this month
content: Foreign investors show confidence in Indian equity market despite India-Pakistan tensions, driven by global cues and domestic fundamentals

title: Drones spotted over Rajasthan’s Barmer, blackout continues in border districts
content: In Barmer, police personnel took to the streets and asked those returning home after closing their shops to switch off the lights of their vehicles

title: Trade unions welcome ceasefire, call for peace in the interest of workers
content: Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) general secretary Tapan Sen said in a statement that upon receiving the news of the stoppage of war, the people from both countries heaved a sigh of great relief as they needed peace for their own progress

title: Senior Puri Jagannath temple priest suspended for involvement in consecration of Digha temple
content: Sevayat Ramkrishna Das Mohapatra had remarked that the daru (sacred wood) used in the Digha temple in West Bengal had been procured from the surplus wood of the Nabakalebara rituals at the Puri shrine

title: Mathurin tossed for sparking Cavs-Pacers fracas
content: Bennedict Mathurin was ejected in the first quarter of Sunday's Game 4, while De'Andre Hunter and Myles Turner were issued technical fouls.

title: OKC overcomes clutch woes to win gritty Game 4
content: The Thunder overcame their crunch-time issues and gritted out a 92-87 win over the Nuggets to even the series 2-2.

title: Reviewed goal irks Jets, helps Stars win Game 3
content: Winnipeg Jets coach Scott Arniel believes the game-winning goal, allowed by Connor Hellebuyck, should not have counted in their Game 3 loss to the Dallas Stars on Sunday night, a 5-2 defeat that put them down 2-1 in their playoff series.

title: Day after 21-0 loss, Rockies fire manager Black
content: The Colorado Rockies, a day after losing by 21 runs to the San Diego Padres at home and off to a major-league-worst 7-33 start, fired manager Bud Black on Sunday and named third-base coach Warren Schaeffer the interim manager for the rest of the season.

title: Source: Raiders sign LB Smith, who sat out '24
content: Veteran linebacker Jaylon Smith is signing with the Raiders after a weekend tryout, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: Aggies lead SEC-heavy top 8 in softball tourney
content: Texas A&M earned the overall No. 1 seed in the NCAA Division I softball tournament on Sunday, leading seven SEC teams seeded in the top eight.

title: Jung hits HR for mom while facing brother Jace
content: Rangers 3B Josh Jung hit a two-run homer in the fifth against his brother's team as their mother, Mary, looked on.

title: ⚾ Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: Barcelona are about to win LaLiga, and Real Madrid let them after a wild Clásico
content: Kylian Mbappé scores a lot, but it means little when Real Madrid have ceded another trophy to Barcelona.

title: Multiple divisions in flux after women's welterweight, flyweight title fights at UFC 315
content: The domino effect from new champion Jack Della Maddalena's win over Belal Muhammad and Valentina Shevchenko's second title reign is going to be interesting.

title: Can the Saints' offense find success with Tyler Shough starting as a rookie?
content: With a new coach and suddenly a new QB, the Saints' offense is hard to predict. Let's explore how this unit could look with Shough under center.

title: European soccer review: Woeful Man Utd, Spurs don't deserve UCL
content: Man Utd and Tottenham are both woeful, yet one will still be in the Champions League next year. It's almost insulting. That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Flick lauds Yamal, 'not a kid,' as Barça nears title
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick lauded Lamine Yamal's grown-up performance after the teenager helped his side move to the brink of the LaLiga title, coming from behind to beat Real Madrid 4-3 on Sunday.

title: Amorim explodes at 'embarrassing' Man Utd form
content: Ruben Amorim has accepted his job will be under threat if he cannot fix Manchester United's Premier League form.

title: Arteta slams 'unacceptable' Arsenal performance
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has described his team's performance against Liverpool as "unacceptable", despite the fact they game from 2-0 down to clinch an important point at Anfield.

title: Forest's Nuno defends owner after on-pitch clash
content: Nottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis stormed onto the pitch to remonstrate with coach Nuno Espirito Santo after Sunday's Premier League draw against Leicester City.

title: Mbappé breaks Madrid record with Clásico hat trick
content: Kylian Mbappé broke the record for the most goals scored in a debut season at Real Madrid after scoring a hat trick in the team's high-stakes Clásico clash with Barcelona on Sunday.

title: Man United left sweating Yoro fitness after injury
content: Manchester United's 2-0 Premier League loss to West Ham United at Old Trafford was compounded by an injury to centre-back Leny Yoro, leaving boss Ruben Amorim with a headache ahead of their Europa League final.

title: Carragher 'surprised' after Alexander-Arnold booed
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold was booed by a number of Liverpool fans in his first game since he announced he intends to leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season.

title: 'Changed' Xabi says goodbye to Leverkusen fans
content: Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso's last home game in charge ended in a 4-2 drubbing by Borussia Dortmund that boosted the visitors' chances of Champions League qualification on Sunday.

title: Cooper Flagg, 5-on-5 workouts and prospects to watch at the NBA draft combine
content: With 120 players expected at the NBA draft combine in Chicago, here's everything to watch out for and know.

title: Inside the goals of WNBA's next CBA -- travel, roster size, and yes, pay
content: Increased salaries, revenue sharing and salary cap are among the issues being negotiated for WNBA's new CBA.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Jadon Sancho's next move could be to Bayer Leverkusen
content: Bayer Leverkusen are willing to offer Jadon Sancho a career lifeline this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Welcome aboard: These are college football's top newcomers
content: From top recruits to big-time transfers, these players look to impact the College Football Playoff hopefuls.

title: Satellite Pics Show 'Before-After' Comparison Of Pak Terror Camps, Airfields
content: The Indian Armed Forces carried out the missile strikes on nine terrorist facilities - four in Pakistan and five in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK).

title: Pics: Top Terrorists Killed In Op Sindoor, Pak Officials Who Attended Funeral
content: India said that more than 100 terrorists were killed in Operation Sindoor, which was launched after a deadly attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: First Calm Night Along Line of Control In Recent Days: Indian Army
content: India and Pakistan, which were involved in intense firing for four days as tensions simmered following a terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam last month, agreed to a ceasefire on Saturday evening.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates:  "Night Remained Largely Peaceful Across J&K, Border Areas," Says Army
content: India Pakistan Tension LIVE Updates: Indian Army said the night remained largely peaceful across Jammu and Kashmir and other areas along the International Border with Pakistan, less than two days after the two neighbours agreed to a ceasefire.

title: 9 Women, 4 Children Killed In Trailer-Truck Collision In Chhattisgarh
content: Thirteen people, all women and children, died and 11 were injured in a collision between a trailer truck and a truck in Raipur, Chhattisgarh, police said.

title: Drunk Man Beats Son, 6, To Death For Not Giving Him Water In Gurugram, Arrested: Cops
content: In a shocking incident, an inebriated man beat his six-year-old son to death for refusing to give him water at a colony in Gurugram, police said on Sunday.

title: US, China Reach Deal To Cut Trade Deficit
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday reported "substantial progress" in US talks with China's top economic officials to de-escalate a damaging trade war, but offered no details of an agreement reached as two days of negotiations wrapped up.

title: 'Went For Head Of Snake': Sources On India's Strike On Pak Terror Bases
content: The Indian government has clarified, both for the world and Pakistan, that it went for the "snake's head and not foot soldiers" this time, demonstrating its new approach to kill terrorists within Pakistan.

title: "Waha Se Goli, Yaha Se Gola": PM's Strong Message To Army On Pak Escalation
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi told the armed forces that the country's response to every action by Pakistan should be more forceful.

title: "Ready To Meet Putin": Ukraine President Zelensky On Ceasefire Talks With Russia
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday he would be ready to meet Vladimir Putin for talks in Istanbul on Thursday after US President Donald Trump told him to agree to an offer of talks with Russia immediately.

title: Trump "Starting To Doubt" Ukraine Will Reach Ceasefire Deal With Russia
content: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he was "starting to doubt" that Ukraine will reach a ceasefire deal with Russia, and he urged Ukraine to meet with Russian officials in Turkey on Thursday to negotiate.

title: 'Supreme Court Can't Be Aloof...': BR Gavai On Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: 'When the country is in danger, the Supreme Court can't be aloof, we are part of the country', said Justice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai, Chief Justice of India designate, on Sunday on the Pahalgam terror attack which claimed 26 lives.

title: "Pak Managed To Internationalise Kashmir": Omar Abdullah To NDTV
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said that the Pahalgam attack has undone years of work both in terms of economy and diplomacy.

title: What S Jaishankar Told Top US Diplomat A Week Before Operation Sindoor
content: India will hit terrorists in Pakistan, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar underlined to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in a phone call on May 1, in the aftermath of the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, sources have told NDTV.

title: After Pahalgam, Visible And Targeted Response To Terror Marks A New Normal
content: India's response to the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that killed 26 tourists has drawn a red line that Pakistan can no longer ignore - that terrorism as a state policy will trigger targeted and visible consequences.

title: 2 Arrested Over Involvement In Spying Activities Linked To Pak Official In Delhi
content: Punjab Police on Sunday said it has arrested two persons including a woman for their alleged involvement in espionage activities linked to a Pakistani official posted at the High Commission in Delhi.

title: Turning Point Was India's Air Strikes: Army Explains Pak's Change In Stance
content: The ceasefire proposal from Pakistan - after four days of missile attack and cross-border firing - was brought about by the air strikes conducted by India, government source said today.

title: "All Indian Pilots Back Home": Air Force On Operation Sindoor
content: The armed forces said today that all its pilots are "back home safe" after the air strikes on Pakistani air bases and other crucial targets. Asked about Pakistan's claim that they have downed two Indian jets at a press conference this evening, the of

title: There Will Be No Discussion With Pak On Kashmir: Sources
content: Pakistan should see uncertainty as the new normal and there will be no discussion with the country on Kashmir, sources said on Sunday.

title: Teachers’ body to stage state-wide protests today
content: The leaders warned that if the government failed to heed the demands, they would intensify the agitation and would stage a massive sit-in at the Vidya Bhavan on May 15

title: Digambara poet urges Naidu to build memorial stupa for Amaravati farmers
content: The names of all farmers who willingly donated their lands for the construction of Amaravati should be etched on a commemorative plaque at the site, says Nagna Muni

title: Displaced people hope to return home as guns fall silent along the LoC in J&K
content: Many villagers in both Jammu and Kashmir regions have returned to their damaged houses and resumed their daily routine; however, many such villages may still remain out of bounds for residents because of littered live explosives

title: New statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj inaugurated at Sindhudurg
content: Less than a year after the previous grand statue collapsed, a bigger ‘structure engineered for durability’ has been inaugurated at the same location by Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis

title: Operation Sindoor objectives achieved; losses are part of combat but pilots are back home, says IAF
content: Indian Air Force’s Director General of Air Operations (DGAO) Air Marshal Bharti on Sunday said, “...at this time I would not like to comment on that because we are still in a combat situation. If I comment on anything, it will be only advantage adversary. So, we don’t want to give him any advantage at this stage.”

title: Gold that went missing from Padmanabhaswamy temple found
content: According to the Fort police, the gold rod which was kept for carrying out gold plating work on the door of the sanctum sanctorum was found on the ground between the strong room and the place where the work was ongoing

title: Clarify if Government accepted third party mediation on Kashmir, says Congress
content: Congress demands clarification on third party mediation in Kashmir, criticises internationalisation attempts, and also recalls 1971 Indo-Pakistan War

title: From a quiet locality to a bustling place
content: Nanganallur was once called Kovil Nagaram because of the temples there. In the 1980s, there were no proper streets, and farming was done at some places, thanks to the Palar water

title: Police conduct ‘flash’ checks across Kurnool
content: The operations were conducted at railway stations, bus stands, and border check-posts, with the assistance of bomb squads, dog squads and crime branch teams.

title: Total Fertility Rate remains constant at 2.0 in 2021: report
content: Bihar has reported the highest TFR at 3.0, while Delhi and West Bengal reported the lowest TFR of 1.4

title: In Nagaland’s Phek, women overcome roadblock to market farm products
content: The business model involves a group of women marketing another group’s processed food derived from the yields of a set of farmers

title: May in Andhra Pradesh starts cooler than usual with below-normal temperatures
content: The IMD predicts thunderstorms, accompanied with lightning and gusty winds, at isolated places across the three regions of Rayalaseema, North and South Coastal Andhra Pradesh till May 18

title: ‘Committed’ to faithful implementation of ceasefire: Pakistan Foreign Office
content: India and Pakistan agreed on May 10 to halt all firing and military actions on land, air, and sea with immediate effect, but the ceasefire came under strain soon after, with India accusing Pakistan of violations

title: NHAI likely to complete DPR for Tiruchi semi ring road project within three months
content: The consultancy firm, appointed in January to prepare the DPR, had completed field visits. It had collected all data required for the preparation of DPR. It had reached its final stage.

title: CCB finds drug peddler they arrested last year still operating from prison
content: CCB gets a court order under the Smugglers and Foreign Exchange Manipulators (Forfeiture of Property) Act, 1976 and seize ₹8.7 Lakh “proceeds of crime”

title: Study finds geotubing at Poonthura effective in controlling coastal erosion
content: One of the major outcomes was the effective prevention of wave overtopping beyond the seawall, extending roughly twice the length of the offshore breakwater on the shore side

title: Bengaluru cab operators hit hard as airport closures impact travel industry post-Pahalgam attack
content: With air travel witnessing a sharp decline, cab drivers and operators in the city are feeling the ripple effects, particularly those who primarily serve airport-bound passengers and tourists.

title: Nipah patient remains in coma
content: The Health department is set to launch a joint outbreak investigation with the support of the Animal Husbandry department on May 12. A surveillance of domestic animals in the region will also begin the same day.

title: Ettukkudi Murugan Temple lacks basic amenities

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 5.5 Hits Tibet, No Reports Of Casualties
content: An earthquake of magnitude 5.5 struck Tibet early on Monday, the China Earthquake Administration (CEA) said. The quake hit the city of Shigatse at 5:11 a.m. (2111 GMT), at a depth of 10 km (6.2 miles). Authorities have dispatched emergency response services and no casualties have been reported so far, CEA said. In January, more than 120 died in a 6.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Tibet's Tingri county, around 240 km (149 miles) away from Shigatse. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
